title: لَوْ الشَّرْطِيَّة
description: Learn about لو الشرطية, the particle used for counterfactual and hypothetical conditions, and how it differs from إن.

notes.title: What is لو الشرطية?
content: لو is a conditional particle for hypothetical situations, typically in the past. It indicates that the condition did NOT happen, so the result also did NOT happen.
It is called حرف امتناع لامتناع: the result was absent because the condition was absent. لَوْ جَاءَ لَأَكْرَمْتُهُ (If he had come, I would have honored him - but he didn't come).
keyPoints: Condition didn't happen → Result didn't happen
Response often starts with لَ (لَأَفْعَلُ، لَفَعَلْتُ)

examples.english: If he had come, I would have honored him
If you had studied, you would have passed
If I had money, I would have given charity
If he had listened to advice, he wouldn't have regretted

notes.title: Structure of لو Sentences
content: A لو sentence has two parts: فعل الشرط (condition) and جواب الشرط (response). Both typically use past tense verbs, even for present/future meaning.
The response (جواب) usually begins with لَ: لَوْ فَعَلَ لَفَعَلْتُ. Sometimes the لَ is omitted.
keyPoints: لَ can be omitted in جواب: لَوْ جَاءَ أَكْرَمْتُهُ

examples.english: If you had visited me, I would have been happy
If I had known, I would have told you
If you had asked him, he would have answered you
If they had strived, they would have won

notes.title: Difference Between لو and إن
content: إن is for possible conditions that may or may not happen. لو is for impossible or counterfactual conditions that didn't happen.
إِنْ تَدْرُسْ تَنْجَحْ (If you study, you will pass - possible). لَوْ دَرَسْتَ لَنَجَحْتَ (If you had studied, you would have passed - didn't happen).
keyPoints: إن uses jussive (مجزوم): إِنْ تَفْعَلْ أَفْعَلْ
لو uses past tense: لَوْ فَعَلْتَ لَفَعَلْتُ

examples.english: If you strive, you will pass (possible)
If you had strived, you would have passed (counterfactual)
If he comes, I will honor him (possible)
If he had come, I would have honored him (didn't come)

notes.title: Special Uses of لو
content: لو can express a wish (التمني): لَوْ تَأْتِينَا (If only you would come to us). It can also come after وَدَّ/يَوَدُّ (to wish): يَوَدُّ لَوْ يُعَمَّرُ.
In Quran: وَلَوْ شَاءَ اللهُ لَجَعَلَهُمْ أُمَّةً وَاحِدَةً (If Allah had willed, He would have made them one nation).
keyPoints: Common in Quran for divine will scenarios
Can express gentle request: لَوْ تَفْعَلُ هَذَا

examples.english: If only you would visit us!
He wishes he could live a thousand years

examples.arabic: وَلَوْ شَاءَ رَبُّكَ لَآمَنَ مَنْ فِي الْأَرْضِ
examples.english: If your Lord had willed, all on earth would have believed
